intro: Staphidium strigosum, commonly known as the hairy staphidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Staphidium strigosum is primarily valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its potential use in traditional medicine.
